Episode¶

class Sakurajima.models.base_models.Episode(data_dict, network, api_url, anime_id, anime_title=None)¶
added¶

The date when the episode was added.

anime_id¶

The anime ID of the anime that the episode belongs to.

anime_title¶

The title of the anime that the episode belongs to.

description¶

The description of the episode.

download(quality: str, file_name: str = None, path: str = None, multi_threading: bool = False, max_threads: int = None, use_ffmpeg: bool = True, include_intro: bool = False, delete_chunks: bool = True, on_progress=None, print_progress: bool = True)¶

Downloads the current episode in your selected quality.

Parameters

  • quality (str) – The quality that you want to dowload. All the available are “ld” (360p), “sd” (480p), “hd” (720p) and “fullhd”. Note that all qualities may not be available for all episodes.

  • file_name (str, optional) – The name of the downloaded file. If left to None, the file will be named “[anime_name] - [episode_number].mp4”. Macros are also supported, “<anititle>” will be replaced by the anime name, <ep> will be replaced by episode number and <eptitle> will be replaced by the episodes title. For example, lets say that the episode in question is the third episode of the anime called “Vinland Saga”. The title of the episode is “Troll”. Suppose we pass the string "<anititle> - <ep> - <eptitle>", the resulting file will be named "Vinland Saga - 3 - Troll.mp4"

  • path (str, optional) – Path to where you want the downloaded video to be, defaults to None. If left None the current working directory i.e. the directory where the script calling the method lives is taken as the path.

  • multi_threading (bool, optional) – Set this to true to enable multithreaded downloading, defaults to False. Enabling this can offer significant performance benefits especially on faster connections. However this comes with a trade off. Using multi threading negatively affects download resumabilty. Therefore it is recommended that this be set to False when using slower connections.

  • max_threads (int, optional) – Set the maximum number of threads that will be used at once when using multi threaded downloading, defaults to None. When None, the maximum number of feasible threads will be used i.e one thread per chunk.

  • use_ffmpeg (bool, optional) – Enable/disable using FFMPEG to combine the downloaded chunks, defaults to True. Requires FFMPEG. It is recommended to keep this enabled as not using FFMPEG can cause video playback issues on certain players. Using FFMPEG also results in noticibly smaller files.

  • include_intro (bool, optional) – Set this to true to include the 5 second aniwatch intro, defaults to False. It is recommended to skip the intro as this causes issues when combining the chunks with FFMPEG.

  • delete_chunks (bool, optional) – Set this to False to not delete the downloaded .ts chunks after they have been, combined into a single mp4 file. Defaults to True

  • on_progress (function, optional) – Register a function that is called every time a new chunk is downloaded. The the number of chunks done and the total number of chunks are passed as arguments to the function in that exact order. Defaults to None.

  • print_progress (bool, optional) – Print the number of chunks done and the total number of chunks to the console, defaults to True.

duration¶

The duration of the episode

ep_id¶

The ID of the episode

filler¶

Is set to 1 if the episode is filler else 0

get_aniwatch_episode(lang='en-US')¶

Gets the AniWatchEpisode object associated with the episode. An AniWatchEpisode has data regarding languages and streams available for the current anime.

Parameters

lang (str, optional) – Used only because the aniwatch API requires it, defaults to “en-US”

Returns

An AniWatchEpisode object.

Return type

AniWatchEpisode

get_available_qualities()¶

Gets a list of available qualities for the episode.

Returns

A list of available qualities. “ld”, “sd”, “hd” and “fullhd” refer to 360p, 480p, 720 and 1080p respectively.

Return type

list[str]

get_m3u8(quality: str) → m3u8.model.M3U8¶

Gets the episode’s M3U8 data.

Parameters

quality (str) – The quality whose M3U8 data you need. All the available are “ld” (360p), “sd” (480p), “hd” (720p) and “fullhd” (1080p).

Returns

A M3U8 object, the data can be accessed by calling the data property on the object.

Return type

M3U8

is_aired¶

Is set to 1 if the episode has aired else 0.

lang¶

The language of the episode.

number¶

The episode number of the episode.

thumbnail¶

The URL to the thumbnail for the episode.

title¶

The title of the episode.

toggle_mark_as_watched()¶

Toggles the “mark as watched” status of the episode

Returns

True if the operation is successful, False if an error occured.

Return type

bool

watched¶

Is set to 1 if the user has marked the episode as watched else 0
